posts.post_content:
This was apparently part of an uncommon "creature types matter" cycle. Originally it was -X/-X, where CX is the number of zombies you control. They had trouble balancing it, ran out of time, and eventually just punted and changed X to 2... and left everything else the same.  
  
There have actually been a lot of "candid confession" stories on the site about Innistrad/Dark Ascension/Avacyn Restored development. For example, the confession that [Archangel's Light](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archangel's Light) was a last minute replacement for a card that they thought might be broken.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
You know what would've made sense? If it had a [Skirsdag High-Priest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirsdag High-Priest) kind of morbid effect. The effect would be that when a creature you control dies (you can make it a certain tribal, whatever), deal deal -1/-1 to a creature other than Farbog.  
  
Well? It's throwing the bones of something dead. Would it make sense if a creature of yours didn't die before this came in as it is? I don't think so.   
  
Either that, or make -2/-2 into -X/-X, where X = total creatures in your graveyard.   
  
Now THAT'S bone-throwing, Gisa.
posts.html:

Well? It's throwing the bones of something dead. Would it make sense if a creature of yours didn't die before this came in as it is? I don't think so.

Either that, or make -2/-2 into -X/-X, where X = total creatures in your graveyard.
